poem:
"Sunset Boulevard's Sorrow"

Sarah Brightman, once radiant star,
Disappoints in Sunset Boulevard.
A washed-up silent sigh, 
Norma Desmond, pitiful and high. 

Webber's call requires might,
A force to unravel the night.
Sarah, oh, you were not it,
In Norma's crisis, your light unlit.

The critics, they can be hard, say,
But so is the end; a bitter Broadway.
